result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Dean Kvaal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley Dean Kvaal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley Dean Kvaal was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

3:15 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Bradley Dean Kvaal. Defendant Bradley Dean Kvaal in court. Includes 22CF197 and 22CF268. DA Anderson recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty Count 2: Disorderly Conduct WITHOUT Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer(WITH Domestic Enhancer)- 947.01(1) in case 22CF197 and Guilty to Count 2: Bail Jumping- Felony-946.49(1)(b). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22CF197 Count 1 and 22CF269 Count 1 and Counts 3-5. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
22CF197 Count 2: I/S 45 days Jail; 1 year Probation   

- 30 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Courts
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Courts
2 days credit

22CF268 Count 2: W/S 18 Months Probation

- 180 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $268.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Courts
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Courts
4 days credit

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- AODA within 30 Days and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by 10/18/22 by 10:30 AM

Money on file to be applied to outstanding balance at JSC and then to any outstanding financial obligations.

Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C. Lebeau.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- Defendant allowed to go to home with Law Enforcement Officer to retrieve personal property.  

- Defendant to have a baseline before being released from custody. 

- Not to possess firearm, Defendant to turn in any firearms by noon 3/26/22. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
